info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:09PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso County through 345 PM MDT... At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fountain, or 15 miles southeast of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Security-Widefield, Fort Carson and Hanover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
